radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is normal in size and appearance. There are no stones nor any signs of sludge, wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. The common hepatic and common bile duct are normal measuring 4 mm in diameter. There is no intrahepatic bile duct dilatation. The liver parenchyma has a normal appearance. The limited views of the pancreas show no peripancreatic fluid collections or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
